The Empire State Building: s lighting schedule: The expert's verdict mentions that the Empire State Building has a calendar for its tower lights, which indicates that on September 11, 2016, the building will be lit "Red, white and blue in memory of September 11." This aspect verifies that the claim of lighting the building green on that date is not true.
Past lighting of the Empire State Buildi: The expert's verdict states that the Empire State Building has been lit Islamic green in the past to celebrate Muslim holidays. This aspect verifies that the building has indeed been illuminated in green for certain occasions, but it does not support the claim that it would be lit green on September 11, 2016.
Significance of September 11: The expert's verdict mentions that honoring a Muslim holiday on September 11 in New York would be considered highly insulting due to the events of 9/11. This aspect highlights the sensitivity surrounding the date and reinforces the unlikelihood of the claim being true.
Date of Eid: al-Adha: The expert's verdict explains that the start of Eid-al-Adha was expected to fall on September 11, 2016, but several prominent Muslim organizations declared that the festival would actually begin on September 12 that year. This aspect confirms that the claim's assertion of celebrating Eid-al-Adha on September 11, 2016, is incorrect.
